intro: Amauropelta decurtata, commonly known as the short-leafed shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome with tufted leaves that are divided into lanceolate segments. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with high humidity. The fronds are leathery and have a distinctive shield-like appearance, which gives the plant its common name.
